blurb: The “Linked Discourses on Dragons” is the first of four similar sections dealing with the modes in which various semi-celestial beings may be reborn. The current chapter is on the “dragons” or nāgas, a powerful but morally ambiguous serpentine creature of the waterways.
Dragons may be born from eggs, the womb, moisture, or spontaneously.

translations.author: ইন্দ্রগুপ্ত ভিক্ষু, সুমন ভিক্ষু, আদিকল্যাণ ভিক্ষু, সীবক ভিক্ষু, রাহুল ভিক্ষু

translations.lang_name: မြန်မာဘာသာ
translations.author: Pitaka Myanmar Translation

blurb: Dragons may be born from eggs, the womb, moisture, or spontaneously. Those born spontaneously are the best.

translations.author: ইন্দ্রগুপ্ত ভিক্ষু, সুমন ভিক্ষু, আদিকল্যাণ ভিক্ষু, সীবক ভিক্ষু, রাহুল ভিক্ষু

translations.lang_name: မြန်မာဘာသာ
translations.author: Pitaka Myanmar Translation

blurb: Egg born dragons sometimes transform their bodies and observe the sabbath in order to get a good rebirth.
